← Back to home

Vocino UI Style Guide

Version: 1.0

Theme Intent: "Dracula vibes" (inky, soft-contrast dark UI) but centered on neon cyan instead of purple.

Constraints: No true black (#000) and no true white (#FFF).

1. Color Tokens

Foundations (Surfaces)

--bg #0F1419 App background
--surface-1 #161B22 Cards / panels
--surface-2 #1E242C Elevated surfaces / menus
--selection #263040 Selection / active row
--border #2B3440 Hairline borders

Text

--text-primary #E6EDF3
--text-secondary #9BA7B4
--text-muted #6B7785
--text-disabled #4B5563

Brand + Accents

--brand #00CCFF Primary / links / focus
--accent-blue #4DA3FF Secondary info accent
--accent-purple #9D7CFF Atmosphere only

Semantic States

--success #3DFA9A
--warning #E6E87A
--attention #FFB86B
--danger #FF5C5C

Gradients

--gradient-primary linear-gradient(90deg, #00CCFF 0%, #4DA3FF 100%)

2. Usage Rules

1. Cyan is scarce and meaningful. Use --brand only for:
  • Primary CTA background or outline
  • Links
  • Focus rings
  • Active navigation indicator
  • Critical highlights (1–2 per screen, ideally)
2. Default UI is neutral: foundations + text.
3. Purple is decorative, not functional (never the only indicator).
4. Avoid pure black/white. Text uses --text-primary, backgrounds use --bg.
5. States must be clear in dark mode: never rely on color alone—use icon/label as well.

3. Component Styling Specs

Buttons

Primary Button

  • Background: --brand
  • Text: --bg
  • Hover: darken background ~8–12% (keep same hue)
  • Focus ring: 0 0 0 3px rgba(0, 204, 255, 0.35)

Secondary Button

  • Background: transparent
  • Border: --border
  • Text: --text-primary
  • Hover background: --surface-2

Destructive Button

  • Background: --danger
  • Text: --bg

Links

This is a default link with hover state.

  • Default: --brand
  • Hover: increase brightness slightly or underline (preferred)

Inputs

  • Background: --surface-1
  • Border: --border
  • Text: --text-primary
  • Placeholder: --text-muted
  • Focus border: --brand
  • Focus ring: rgba(0, 204, 255, 0.25)

Cards / Panels

Card Title

This is a card component with hover state. Hover to see the elevation change.

  • Background: --surface-1
  • Border: --border
  • Hover: background → --surface-2
  • Radius: 14–18px

4. Typography

Font Families

The Vocino design system uses the Source font family from Google Fonts, providing a cohesive typographic system across all text styles.

Source Sans 3

Primary sans-serif font for UI, body text, and headings

The quick brown fox
jumps over the lazy dog
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
0123456789 !@#$%^&*()
300 400 500 600 700
Usage: Body text, UI elements, buttons, labels, navigation

Source Serif 4

Serif font for long-form content and emphasis

The quick brown fox
jumps over the lazy dog
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
0123456789 !@#$%^&*()
400 500 600 700
Usage: Long-form articles, quotes, special headings, editorial content

Source Code Pro

Monospace font for code, technical content, and data

const hello = "world";
function example() {
return true;
}
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
0123456789 !@#$%^&*()
400 500 600 700
Usage: Code blocks, inline code, terminal output, technical documentation

Type Scale

Heading 1 (32–40px)

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 600–700

Heading 2 (24–28px)

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 600–700

Heading 3 (18–20px)

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 600–700

Body text (14–16px) - This is example body text showing the default font weight of 400–500. It should be readable and comfortable for extended reading.

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 400–500

Label text (14–16px)

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 500–600

Caption text (12–13px)

Font: Source Sans 3 | Weight: 400–500

Google Fonts Import

<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Source+Sans+3:wght@300;400;500;600;700&family=Source+Serif+4:wght@400;500;600;700&family=Source+Code+Pro:wght@400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">

CSS Variables

// SCSS Variables
$font-family-sans: "Source Sans 3", sans-serif;
$font-family-serif: "Source Serif 4", serif;
$font-family-mono: "Source Code Pro", monospace;
$font-family-base: $font-family-sans;

5. Spacing, Radii, Shadows

Spacing Scale (px)

4
8
12
16
24
32
48

Radii

12px Buttons / Inputs
16px Cards / Panels
18px Modals

Shadows (Subtle)

Elevation 1 0 6px 18px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35)
Elevation 2 0 12px 32px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.45)

6. CSS Variables

:root {
  --bg: #0F1419;
  --surface-1: #161B22;
  --surface-2: #1E242C;
  --selection: #263040;
  --border: #2B3440;

  --text-primary: #E6EDF3;
  --text-secondary: #9BA7B4;
  --text-muted: #6B7785;
  --text-disabled: #4B5563;

  --brand: #00CCFF;
  --accent-blue: #4DA3FF;
  --accent-purple: #9D7CFF;

  --success: #3DFA9A;
  --warning: #E6E87A;
  --attention: #FFB86B;
  --danger: #FF5C5C;

  --gradient-primary: linear-gradient(90deg, #00CCFF 0%, #4DA3FF 100%);
}

7. Tailwind Tokens (Optional Mapping)

Use these as theme.extend.colors targets in your Tailwind configuration.

// tailwind.config.js
module.exports = {
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        bg: '#0F1419',
        surface1: '#161B22',
        surface2: '#1E242C',
        selection: '#263040',
        border: '#2B3440',
        
        textPrimary: '#E6EDF3',
        textSecondary: '#9BA7B4',
        textMuted: '#6B7785',
        textDisabled: '#4B5563',
        
        brand: '#00CCFF',
        accentBlue: '#4DA3FF',
        accentPurple: '#9D7CFF',
        
        success: '#3DFA9A',
        warning: '#E6E87A',
        attention: '#FFB86B',
        danger: '#FF5C5C',
      }
    }
  }
}

8. Accessibility Notes

Maintain readable contrast for body text on --surface-1 and --bg.
Focus rings must be visible on all surfaces (use the provided cyan alpha).
Never convey meaning with color alone; pair with icon + copy.
